messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Books on unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... Not an unschooling book, though. (Just so the person asking knows.) John Gatto s Dumbing Us Down is a short collection of speeches and gives a good
messages.messageBody:
On Dec 16, 2003, at 5:35 PM, Elizabeth Roberts wrote:

> "The Underground History of American Education" by John Taylor Gatto,
> as well as his other writings (however many of the same points of his
> other writings are also covered to some degree within Underground...
>

Not an unschooling book, though. (Just so the person asking knows.)

John Gatto's "Dumbing Us Down" is a short collection of speeches and
gives a good feeling for some of the serious consequences to
schoolishness. Can help someone give up some of their school urges.

-pam

National Home Education Network
<www.NHEN.org>
Serving the entire homeschooling community since 1999
through information, networking and public relations.

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Books on unschooling
messages.messageBody:
Read it online at http://johntaylorgatto.com/chapters/index.htm

-Tracy-

> "The Underground History of American Education" by John Taylor Gatto

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Books on unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Frank Smith s, The Book of Learning and Forgetting. (Not a book about unschooling, but about learning and fantastic for understanding unschooling.) Ann
messages.messageBody:
Frank Smith's, "The Book of Learning and Forgetting." (Not a book about
unschooling, but about learning and fantastic for understanding
unschooling.)

Ann Lahrson-Fischer's "Fundamentals of Homeschooling: Notes on
Successful Family Living."

Mary Griffith's, "The Unschooling Handbook : How to Use the Whole World
As Your Child's Classroom."

Valerie Fitzenreiter's, "The Unprocessed Child: Living Without School."

Grace Llewelyn's, "The Teenage Liberation Handbook: How to Quit School
and Get a Real Life and Education."

John Holt's, "Learning All the Time."

Sandra Dodd's website at www.sandradodd.com/unschooling

Lillian Jones' website at www.besthomeschooling.org also has a lot of
articles by many different people about unschooling.

-pam
